intro: Filago californica var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of California. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial species that produces seeds through its showy inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
